item.title: Advice
item.dc:creator: sbcadmin
item.content:encoded:
This is an example page. It's different from a blog post because it will stay in one place and will show up in your site navigation (in most themes). Most people start with an About page that introduces them to potential site visitors. It might say something like this:
Hi there! I'm a bike messenger by day, aspiring actor by night, and this is my website. I live in Los Angeles, have a great dog named Jack, and I like piña coladas. (And gettin' caught in the rain.)
...or something like this:
The XYZ Doohickey Company was founded in 1971, and has been providing quality doohickeys to the public ever since. Located in Gotham City, XYZ employs over 2,000 people and does all kinds of awesome things for the Gotham community.
As a new WordPress user, you should go to your dashboard to delete this page and create new pages for your content. Have fun!

item.title: Business disputes
item.dc:creator: sbcadmin
item.content:encoded:
Get help with your business dispute

This is an intro text

How this will work:

  • You will answer X multiple choice questions
  • You will then be shown a page of advice about the options available to you in getting help with your business dispute
Start now

item.title: q1
item.dc:creator: sbcadmin
item.content:encoded: Does your business consist of fewer than 50 staff?

item.title: q2
item.dc:creator: sbcadmin
item.content:encoded: Consider the business you are having a dispute with — does it have fewer than 50 staff?

item.title: Home
item.dc:creator: sbcadmin
item.content:encoded:
Small Business Commissioner

The Small Business Commissioner helps small businesses to form fairer business relationships with large clients and promotes a positive business culture.

item.title: Results
item.dc:creator: sbcadmin
item.content:encoded:
Advice on how to get help with your business dispute

A number of options are presented below, starting from a low escalation level and rising to a high level.

item.title: Direct Negotiation
item.dc:creator: sbcadmin
item.content:encoded:
Most business disputes occur because there is a breakdown in communication. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetuer adipiscing elit.

item.title: SBC Complaints
item.dc:creator: sbcadmin
item.content:encoded:
This is some intro text

Lorem ipsum...

item.title: Initial investigation
item.dc:creator: sbcadmin
item.content:encoded: During initial Investigation, the Small Business Comissioner confirms whether the complaint requires a full investigation. This phase can take up to 2 weeks.

item.title: Gathering data from complainant
item.dc:creator: sbcadmin
item.content:encoded:
A formal determination begins by gathering a full account by the complainaint. The duration of this phase depends largely on the complainant but is limited to a maximum of four weeks.

If the Small Business Commissioner finds it necessary to gather additional information at a later point of the determination processes, the complaint may return to this status.

item.title: Hello world!
item.dc:creator: sbcadmin
item.content:encoded: Welcome to WordPress. This is your first post. Edit or delete it, then start writing!

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Hi, this is a comment. To get started with moderating, editing, and deleting comments, please visit the Comments screen in the dashboard. Commenter avatars come from Gravatar.

item.title: Gathering data from respondent
item.dc:creator: sbcadmin
item.content:encoded:
Once the nature of the complaint is established, the Small Business Commissioner gives the respondent to the complaint the opportuniy to remark on the complaint, ensuring a balanced view of the dispute. The duration of this phase depends largely on the respondent but is limited to a maximum of four weeks.

If the Small Business Commissioner finds it necessary to gather additional information at a later point of the determination processes, the complaint may return to this status.

item.title: Making determination
item.dc:creator: sbcadmin
item.content:encoded:
Once the Small Business Commissioner is satisfied that the dispute has been fully explained, a full review of all information supplied begins. The Small Business Commissioner makes a determination and creates a report that may contain advice about how the dispute can be resolved and avoided in the future.

This phase of the process may take four to six weeks.

item.title: Gathering responses for determination
item.dc:creator: sbcadmin
item.content:encoded:
When the Small Business Commissioner has shared the determination with the complainaint and the respondent, both parties have an opportunity to comment on the determination.

In some cases, the Small Business Commissioner may choose to make the report available to the public; in this event, any comments by the complainant and the respondent will be included in the publication.

item.title: Closed
item.dc:creator: sbcadmin
item.content:encoded:
Closed

The investigation of this dispute is concluded. No further activity is expected.
